title: Skrillex, Martin Garrix, Zedd and More to Headline Ultra Music Festival 2025: See the Full Lineup
description: Other headliners of Ultra's historic 25th anniversary festival include Hardwell, Carl Cox and Charlotte de Witte, among many other influential DJs and dance music producers.
author: Jason Heffler
excerpt: Other headliners of Ultra's historic 25th anniversary festival include Hardwell, Carl Cox and Charlotte de Witte, among many other influential DJs and dance music producers.

html:
Other headliners of Ultra's historic 25th anniversary festival include Hardwell, Carl Cox and Charlotte de Witte, among many other influential DJs and dance music producers.

Other headliners of Ultra's historic 25th anniversary festival include Hardwell, Carl Cox and Charlotte de Witte, among many other influential DJs and dance music producers.

  • Home
  • EVENTS

25 years after the debut of Ultra, its organizers are poised for the biggest and best festival in its storied run.

Celebrating its quarter-century anniversary in 2025, Ultra is returning to its longtime home of Bayfront Park from March 28-30. The festival today revealed its full lineup, which is arguably its most impressive lineup yet.

It features Martin Garrix, Knife Party, Gesaffelstein, Hardwell, Zedd, Nero, Alesso, Armin van Buuren, Axwell, Charlotte de Witte, Above & Beyond, Gryffin, Afrojack, Chase & Status and Tiësto, among many others. Dubstep icon Skrillex will also headline, marking his return to Ultra after 10 years.

A surefire highlight of the lineup is the first-ever b2b DJ set from deadmau5 and Pendulum, a pair of prevailing pioneers of electronic music. Attendees can also look forward to collaborative sets from Anyma b2b Solomun, LSZEE (LSDREAM and CloZee) and Everything Always, the alias of Dom Dolla and John Summit.

Scroll to Continue

Recommended Articles

Ultra 2025 will also see the return of techno legend Carl Cox, who did not appear last year after performing a staggering 19 times since the festival's debut in 1999. He's once again taking over Ultra's storied RESISTANCE MegaStructure to debut a brand-new live show, "Evolution," according to a press release. Fellow techno icon Richie Hawtin will also headline the stage, bringing his innovative "DEX EFX X0X" production to Ultra for the first time.

Ultra is scheduled to return to its longtime home of Bayfront Park from March 28-30, 2025 and tickets are on sale now. Check out the festival's full lineup below.
